document_data.name: ''Oil of acid resistance''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Oil of acid resistance''''' was a [[magic item|magical]] unguent that rendered any cloth, skin, or other material it was applied to impervious to harm from [[acid]].
document_data.Description: Each flask of ''oil of acid resistance'' was sufficient to cover the entire body and equipment of a [[human]]-sized creature. Alternatively, a flask contained enough doses to cover twenty-four human-sized creatures for an active period of one hour.
document_data.Powers: One application of this oil lasted for a period of twenty-four hours. However, any exposure to acid would diminish the period of potency by a number of minutes equivalent to how much damage that exposure would have caused to exposed flesh. For example, if someone was exposed to the acid [[dragon breath|breath]] of a [[black dragon]] of [[great wyrm]] age the potency period would diminish by 1 hour and 4 minutes.
document_data.Components: Some [[wizard]]s were known to use the dried webbing of [[greelox]] as an ingredient in making these oils. Other potential ingredients for making these oils included the secretions of [[stone pudding]]s, the mucous coating of [[gray ooze]]s,<ref>{{Cite dragon annual/1999/The Ecology of the Gray Ooze|132}} and the inner layer of [[flumph]] tentacles. It took twenty flumph tentacles to yield a single serving of ''oil of acid resistance''.
